column4: how do i go back to my old video drivers? windows takes more then 1 second to redraw on the screen when i move them across the desktop, or scroll webpages.
are you using a restricted driver?
no i am not.
i tried using dual displays, and now i unhooked the 2nd monitor, rebooted, and now i'm in chaos.
i was wondering what u meant by "old video driver"
the one that worked better? something changed. I can't enable desktop effects. says it's unable to enable.
have you tried check screen resolutions under /systems/preference/screen resolutions
windows draw HORRIBLY slow, even xchat scrolling
i never changed screen resolutions. always been using the same res since the 6.x days
screen resolution does more than it name says .. it can also be used to configure and unconfigure a dual screen setup
yes. i used it and removed the dual screen setup, rebooted, and now i have poor display performance.
the only fix i can think of is to format the drive and reinstall, but, i don't think i need to go such extreme.
no dont do that .. yet .. what graphic card are u using
intel graphics media accelerator 900
it was totally fine before, shadows, transparencies, compiz effects, all fast and clean and quick. now i can't get it enabled, and seems like 2d display is straight up murder. 2.2ghz too....
ok try this .. put in an ubuntu life cd .. and replace the xorg.conf file with the one in the life cd .. that is what i do most of the time and it always work
wonder if there's the generic live one posted somewhere on the 'net...
they could be .. but ubuntu auto configure xorg to suit ur machine needs .. that is why a generic xorg config might not fit it
ok why not paste bin your xorg.conf
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
just prings debconf: DbDriver "config": /var/cache/debconf/config.dat is locked by another process: Resource temporarily unavailable
any luck?
i got it back!!!
